intro: Mitracarpus frigidus var. glaberrimus, commonly known as the glabrous frosty mitracarpus, is a rare and delicate plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and unique, spiky inflorescences that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil to flourish. Its limited distribution and specific habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists studying alpine flora. Due to its fragile nature, it is often found in protected areas where it can survive the harsh climatic conditions of its native range.
